data.title: fix CHANGES, add new changes under tentative 1.0.0 heading
forgot to replace english names with actual characters
Support 'size' as a json skin data value for BitmapFont
data.body: This change adds font size support to BitmapFont definitions in skin json files

data.title: Sprite alpha
Bad implementation of method overlaps in Circle
Possible bug in modelbatch.render
data.body:
I've a 3d "world" with many planes. 
-  Each plane has a different size
-  Each plane has a different _z_ coordinate
-  Each plane is parallel to the others.
-  Each plane moves around the x or y coordinates according to some user input.

I've a field called _instances_ which is of type _Array<ModelInstance>_ the elements in this _instances_ array are inserted by _z_ sorting. (Eg: the element at index _'i'_ has a z value lower than any other element with _index>i_ )

When In the render method i call the following

``` java
                    modelBatch.begin(cam);
                    modelBatch.render(instances, environment);
                    modelBatch.end();
```

In some cases, some layers disappear going away. I don't think this is a z fighting cause i disabled the DEPTH_TEST in the render method and also because I tried with only 2 semi transparent layers and one simply disappeared.

The following code will perform a single ModelInstance draw per begin/end block And everything works as expected

``` java
            for (int i=0;i<instances.size; i++) {
                    modelBatch.begin(cam);
                    modelBatch.render(instances.get(i), environment);
                    modelBatch.end();
            }
```

For a visual effect of what I mean take a look at the following pictures. In order to understand the pictures you've to know that
- 2 semi transparent layers are drawn here
- 1 contains the text "TURN ON THE" ( coordinates on right side of the screen: 5x, 5y, 5z)
- 1 contains the text "DARKEST OF TIMES" (coordinates in the right side of the screen (4x, 4y, 4z)

![glitch](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2462575/Screenshot_2013-12-01-14-54-44.png)
![notglitch](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/2462575/Screenshot_2013-12-01-14-54-49.png)

data.title: Added elementTypes to gwt reflection
data.body:
- Added elementTypes to gwt reflection to support field.getElementType in GWT
- switched types form Set to List and added some sorting in ReflectionCacheSourceCreator so the generated code stays more stable between runs
- corrected Type.isAssignableFrom (the logic was switched)
- Reverted some changes form PR #1005 as they broke things for copying primitive fields using reflection.
  I am using something like:
  
   field.set(obj, field.get((other.obj));

Example generated JS code:

```
case 107837400:
  java_lang_String_$equals__Ljava_lang_String_2Ljava_lang_Object_2Z($intern_3466, param) && com_badlogic_gwtref_client_IReflectionCacheGenerated_$s5648__Lcom_badlogic_gwtref_client_IReflectionCacheGenerated_2Lcom_rustybyte_es_components_CMusic_2ZV(com_google_gwt_lang_Cast_dynamicCast__Ljava_lang_Object_2ILjava_lang_Object_2(obj, Q$com_rustybyte_es_components_CMusic), java_lang_Boolean_$booleanValue__Ljava_lang_Boolean_2Z(com_google_gwt_lang_Cast_dynamicCast__Ljava_lang_Object_2ILjava_lang_Object_2(value_0, Q$java_lang_Boolean)));
  break;
```

Results in the following exception for a boolean field:


data.title: Timer gives exception on Android if the constructor is called.
gdx-setup-ui.jar is not working
data.body:
I double click, nothing happens.

I opened cmd from the foler, did: java gdx-setup-ui.jar and I get:

Error: Could not find or load main class gdx-setup-ui.jar
I just updated the JRE recently, to 1.7.0_45, and JDK is 1.6.0_18

When I do this:
java -jar gdx-setup-ui.jar, I get this:

http://www.pastebin.ca/2485333

I used to create libgdx projects before also, and it used to work. I'm using Windows Vista.

data.title: initial commit of new LwjglHeadlessApplication for a headless libgdx
data.body:
A headless version of LwjglApplication called LwjglHeadlessApplication that can be used for servers or other desktop platforms without graphics, audio or input.

I have not tested this extensively.  I only made a very simple libgdx program and confirmed it runs on my VPS.

also some very minor LwjglApplication cleanup:
- replaced HashMap with ObjectMap
- explicitly parameterized Runnable Array objects

data.title: PointLight doesn't work with GLES20.
data.body:
I tried to debug this for 2 days without any luck. (I'm using 2013 Nexus 7", if it matters)

Basically following the example presented at http://blog.xoppa.com/basic-3d-using-libgdx-2/

and switched the line below

environment.add(new DirectionalLight().set(0.8f, 0.8f, 0.8f, -1f, -0.8f, -0.2f));

to 

environment.add(new PointLight().set(1.0f, 1.0f, 0.5f, new Vector3(0f, 10f, 0f), 100f));

If I start my application with cfg.useGL20 = false in my main activity, it works fine, but
if I switch to cfg.useGL20 = true; then PointLight doesn't seem to work as expected.

![gles20 false](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3702017/1642902/9ad12624-58a7-11e3-9955-a4f9d0de34d3.png)

cfg.useGL20 = false output

![gles20 true](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/3702017/1642905/b48df93e-58a7-11e3-8e33-eaa9b485bcf7.png)

cfg.useGL20 = true output (ignore volume control)

data.title: Image::setDrawable doesnâ€™t work
Provision to set Camera zoom In/Out values in CameraInputController or wherever possible
data.body:
Could it be please possible to have the provision to set Camera zoom In & Out values.
So that programmatically we can set these values as desired when implementing "CameraInputController" as presently by default testing apps on desktop it zooms in/out properly but on actual devices it is hardly noticable on pinch and it varies only by a very tiny amount which is quite unusable.
Thx

data.title: added valueOf(String keyname) and toString(int keycode) to Input.Keys
data.body:
Allows getting a string representation of the hardcoded int keycodes without using an enum.

one concern: BUTTON_CIRCLE and F12 both map to 255, I chose to handle it by ignoring BUTTON_CIRCLE, since F12 is much more likely to be pressed (what is BUTTON_CIRCLE anyways?)

~~The lookup in valueOf could be made faster (it iterates through all keycodes), but using an IntMap means minimal memory footprint, and it should be fast enough for vast majority of cases.~~

data.title: Texture is vertically flipped when applied to a plane/rect created with MeshPartBuilder
documentation cleanup
data.body: doc cleanup and one code change: made Version.VERSION string a final

data.title: IOSGraphics returning wrong width and height
data.body:
The dimensions returned by IOSGraphics.getWidth() and getHeight() don't seem to take into account whether the status bar is hidden, which leads to a "squashed" image if it's visible.

To test the bug, edit the Info.plist.xml file and change the value of the "UIStatusBarHidden" key to <false/>.

data.title: Changed method 'color()' to 'setColor()' in Javadoc
data.body: There was no such method called `color()` in `ShapeRenderer`, but one was stated in the documentation.

data.title: Changed newInstance to protected in Json
data.body: Enables overload in the instance creation (to use Pools instead of reflection, for example).

data.title: Array.ensureCapacity(int) will always resize the underlying array if repeatedly passed the same value
data.body:
For example if you do:

```
for(int i = 0; i < 100; i++)
    array.ensureCapacity(123)
```

the underlying array is recreated/resized 100 times.

line 314:

```
    if (sizeNeeded >= items.length) resize(Math.max(8, sizeNeeded));
```

should be changed to:

```
    if (sizeNeeded > items.length) resize(Math.max(8, sizeNeeded));
```

data.title: ModelBatch: keep track of obtained renderables and other changes
data.body:
Only free renderables actually obtained. This doesn't forces the RenderableProvider to always obtain renderables from the pool anymore. E.g. this way a particle emitter can be a RenderableProvider while using its own internal renderable(s). Also only set the shader and/or environment if specified (thus depending on the method signature), by default this is the same behavior (they are set to null on obtain), but it allows the RenderableProvider to specify its own Shader or Environment.

DefaultShader: use Config instead of static variables for e.g. defaultCullFace.
